author: Steven
items: Better Call Saul - Final Season - I was late on this, but yeah.  Perfect.

The Bear - Seasons 1 & 2 (I watched 1 in Jan I think) - Can we get more stuff like this? Low budget, heartfelt, original, riveting, creative, funny.  I suppose that's a lot to ask.  But I hope people are out there trying.
Fleishman is in Trouble (I think this dropped end of 22)
What we do in the Shadows

Murder at the End of the World - This one's in progress! Could move up or down.  I will give Brit Marling and Zal Batmanglij whatever chances they want, and I'm glad someone with money let them make another thing.  The OA was fucking insane and they're only slightly more reigned in with this show.
Survivor. I decided Season 45 was the right time to give it a chance.

author: Steven
items: Lana Del Rey - Did you know that there's a tunnel under ocean boulevard?

author: Grayson
items: The Longest 3rd Date (Couple leaves country right before pandemic. Big mistake or the best idea ever?)
Ordinary Men (About the Germans who worked the firing squads. Fascinating behavioral study.)
World War 2: From The Front Lines (WW2 stuff in color? Stop)
Life on Our Planet (Gosh it’s so fucking awesome. Goes scientific and actually explains HOW shit happened.)
MADOFF: The Monster of Wall Street (Never trust a boss who handles payroll. Grayson learned this the hard way)
The Garden : Commune or Cult (Less crazy white people than last two)
American Manhunt: The Boston Marathon Bombing (I still can’t believe all the shit that went down the first 72 hrs of that)
Murder in Boston (Dude fingers a black dude for his wife’s murder-wait what?)
Til Murder Do Us Part: Soaring vs. Haysom

author: Grayson
items: All the Light We Cannot See (Limited Series)
Guillermo del Toro’s Cabinet of Curiosities: Season 1
Cunk on Earth (Grayson loves dry ridiculous humor)

author: Grayson
items: All Quiet on the Western Front
Downsizing - What a refreshing film about people “getting small

author: Grayson
items: Rolling Stones - Hackney Diamonds (Keep in mind I’m not a Rollin Stones fan.)
Gregory Alan Isakov - Appaloosa Bones (I’ve told Steven and Robbie about this. It was like “too laid back” for me but it GREW hard on me.
Green Day - Saviors (Steven..give it…give it a try.)
Kim Petras (I’m not a big fan of her GAY SEX albums but I love everything else.)
Judas Priest - Invincible Shield (Who knew this would be in here? Not…not me.)

author: Grayson
items: Dead Island 2 (Possibly the most “fun” game I’ve played in a while)
A Plague Tale Requiem (Better than the first. That’s right mf.)
NBA 2K24 (finally learned how to play it and I’m excelling)
World War Z Aftermath (What a TREAT.)
Tomb Raider Rise Of (It’s 2017ish graphics but so impressive)

author: Zach
items: Shrinking - Crying and laughing during nearly every episode is hard to beat
The Last of Us - did not play the game, but didn't feel I needed to. The episode we all already know about was devastatingly beautiful
Beef - huge crush on Ali Wong before seeing this, and the gun scene just solidified that for me
Fall of the House of Usher - horror is not my thing, but this really fucked
Blue Eye Samurai - anime/cartoons not my thing, but this REALLY fucked. Might have liked it better than anything else I read, saw or listened to in 2023
One Piece - I had to try it, right? It was cute, but I will not be watching the 1,110 episodes of the animated version

author: Zach
items: Hidden Signal - an anthology series with some bangers

author: Steven
items: 3 Body Problem S1 (meh, it's not that well executed.  But I love the books so much that I'm just happy to see it on screen)
Ren Faire (must watch, even if it fades at the end)
What We do in the Shadows final season! (Only watched half so far. I think the other half of episodes just dropped)
House of the Dragon S2 (Much better than S1)

author: Steven
items: Vampire Weekend - Only God Was Above Us
Godwin Falcon - We Should Already Be Dead (SHOUTOUT TO PAUL)
1010Benja - Ten Total (Seriously listen to this.  It's like Justin Timberlake meets an extremely on drugs rapper.  One of the more bizarre albums I've enjoyed lately.  It'll keep you on your toes.)

author: Steven
items: Tim Dillon's appearance on Theo Vonn's podcast

author: Grayson
items: Ashley Madison: Sex, Lies & Scandal (So hard to believe this happened then again people ARE very stupid.)
Breath of Fire (More cult stuff. Never gets old)
Hell Camp: Teen Nightmare (Rich parents just fed up with their kids but NOT DOING ENOUGH research)
Mysteries of the Terracotta Warriors (Asians were crazy violent back in the day)
It’s Florida Man (You all know how much I dislike the state of Florida. (they do?) But I love this series.) How do y’all handle interior parentheses?
Untold: The Murder of Air McNair (I used to be a Titans fan so this was sad.)
What Jennifer Did (Didn’t….didn’t care for her parents for one.)
30 for 30: The Life and Trials of Oscar Pistorius

author: Grayson
items: Fall of the House of Usher (Carla Gugino shout out!)
Severance (Watched the first handful of eps. Hopefully it stays weird.)
Katt Williams: Woke Foke (He redeemed himself after the last one)
LOST (I’m VERY late. But it’s such an easy watch.)

author: Grayson
items: Dark Waters (Best socio political film I’ve seen)
Waitress The Musical (Trying to not praise Robbie’s nemesis Joe Tippett’s performance but he brought HEART to the villain role)
St. Elmo’s Fire (I….I just saw it.)
Godzilla Minus One (Finally it’s back in the hands of the Japanese {-- May never say this sentence again.)
Don’t Move (Chick gets drugged and has to run away without being able to move??!)
Babylon (Everyone who disliked this film is fucking wrong)
Please Don’t Destroy: The Treasure of Foggy Mountain (A comedy? In this day and age?)
Saltburn (Ending is so nauseating but still dope)

author: Grayson
items: Halo Infinite (I am so late on this but I have finally found the beauty of this series again.)
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 (Incredible graphics and gameplay. Zero storyline.)
Microsoft Flight Simulator 24 (I’m about to start a career in crop dusting)
Dragon’s Dogma II (Almost better than Elden Ring. I SAID IT.)
NCAA College Football 25 (I’ve gotten much better since Steven kicked my ass in my parents home)

author: Zach
items: Shrinking - in love with every character from this show
Kaos - I know, I know. It wasn't that good...but I binged it and loved the debauchery and moral reflections that are relevant today. Also some beautifully-shot scenes I'd watch again
Lost - this was my first viewing as well - I also followed an episode recap subreddit because I'm a fucking nerd.
Sugar - not gonna lie, I hated the twist
Baby Reindeer - just too good a story and acting to miss
Bodkin - was shot in my in-laws' village in Ireland and I highly recommend visiting Kilaloe

author: Zach
items: The Good Whale - Serial-produced podcast about Free Willy star, Keiko. It is the best thing I listened to or watched in 2024. I cried often.

author: Amanda
items: Nobody wants this - Kristen Bell + Adam Brody can do no wrong

Lost—Okay, hear me out. I never watched Lost when it first aired and needed something easy to put on in the background (agree with you there, Grayson. We are late and it is an easy watch! So funny we both did that.). Let me tell you, I was committed to all the seasons, even though after season 3, it really went downhill. I really liked it and don't really get the hate for the ending. It made sense to me!
Survivor - again it makes the list. Seriously fantastic show, I love it week after week!
What we do in the shadows - I am so so sad this show ended!
